function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'putchar' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Is it possible that the loop with condition '*p' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition '*p' always executed?
Is it possible that the loop with condition '!((x >> --i' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition '!((x >> --i' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition '*p' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition '!((x >> --i' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'argc' affect subsequent computations?
Is variable 'argv (line 2)' used after its definition?
liveness: Does variable 'x' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
Is variable 'p' live at the end of function 'main'?
dead_code: Is the statement 'for (char *p = argv[1]; *p; p++) {' unreachable?
Can the program actually reach the statement: “while (!((x >> --i) & 1));”?
